body:
Comment 5 by **evandrix**: 
I succeeded on previous versions, just not this one.

The files are indeed present in `/usr/local/go`, as you've mentioned.

Yep, removing this directory and trying again causes that folder to be re-created, and
the files re-installed within.

It's just that I'm getting the final dialog from the pkg installer notifying me that the
installation has failed.

I've gone a step further and tried to install the .pkg file in verbose mode, using the
command `sudo -S installer -verbose -pkg $1 -target /`. However, when it's installing
the files & package scripts, all I see are single lines of "#" or "..." with no paths of
files being installed indicated (referring to a similar output from `unrar x` or `unzip`)

Having no diagnostic messages whatsoever to go on is making debugging sufficiently
difficult that I've to call for help here by submitting a new issue, otherwise I'd have
tried solving it myself (can't show package contents of the .pkg either)
